intro: Catabrosa viridula, commonly known as the green catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Catabrosa viridula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
